reviews.review:
Simple and fun. Very short, but charming - albeit campy at times (in an unintentional way).

Score would be lower if it wasn't free or near-free.

7/10
Good game,not worth $10 in 2022 but if on sale then recommended. There's a reason why its considered a classic.
There are few more well rounded puzzle games, even today.
Its like Splitgate but alot more dead bodies, suprisingly less laura palmers killed...
Still one of the best games of all time

Portal is a physics based puzzle solving game with an inkling of action involved.

Synopsis:
Welcome to Aperture Science Labs controlled by the GLaDOS robot. You're one of many test subjects completing various courses relating to the usage of Aperture's portal technology. Along the way, GLaDOS will provide words of reassurance and guidance. You're promised cake by the end of your trial, so pat yourself on the back when it's all said and done. Good luck [subject name here] and hope you make it back to [subject hometown here].

Controls
Space = Jump
WASD = Locomotion
Left Mouse Button = Shoot Blue Portal
Right Mouse Button = Shoot Red[Orange] Portal
Ctrl = Crouch
E = Interact/Grab

Achievement Hunters will definitely want to consult a guide or walkthrough if 100% completion is your goal. Sometimes, the extracurricular challenges prove frustrating or infuriating. Stay persistent, taking break regularly, and finding ways to exploit the game to complete nearly impossible criteria. Good luck!

Great game, pretty short but a very nice experience to play when your bored or just feel like going back to aperture science. Other than it being short portal is a very good game at a well balanced price

So it is 2022, I have had a Steam account for like 7 years, and I have never left a review for a game. I just completed Portal for the first time (yes I am very late to the party on it) but I have to say, the community that has rallied behind this game for years really is special, and after completing the game finally for myself I can say I really understand why it generally was received the way it was. Valve, make more games. Truly a masterpiece. Time for Portal 2!

I'm surprised people even still have the option to leave reviews on this game. 

I mean. 

It's fucking Portal. 

Literally one of the actual cornerstones of modern gaming meme culture. Either you already know all there is to reasonably know or you're new to this whole... computer games thing, and in which case, yes obviously, play it; but you really don't need to take my word for it.

Bravo a VALVE

A surprisingly short but really fun, creative and mind boggling game. It allows multiple ways to beat a level (pretty sure I've beat one not how the game wanted me too). I still prefer the second one just because of Co-op but as I said this was really fun as well. But yeah, surprisingly short, after the final battle I thought that was just end of chapter one or something but no, it was in fact the end of the game. And I gotta give a 10/10 for the sarcasm and the credits song itself. Pure. Gold.
It is good. It is fun. It is challenging.
Portal is honestly one of my favorite games of literally all time. I've owned this game since probably 2018 or so and it's still incredible, 4 years after purchase, and 16 years after release.
This game is amazing ive been wanting to play for years and when i play it for the first time i love it
i wouldn't mind listening to the same radio song for 200 years sounds fire
